pull.title: Print to console by default when not run with -daemon
pull.body:
Cherry-picked ef6fa1c38e1bd115d1cce155907023d79da379d8 from the "up for grabs" PR: "Smarter default behavior for -printtoconsole" (#12689).

See previous review in #12689.

events.message:
Print to console by default when not run with -daemon

Printing to the debug log file can be disabled with -nodebulogfile

events.body: Previous utACK:ers @MeshCollider and @jnewbery might want to take a look at this one too? :-)

Thanks for reviving this, tested ACK 6a3b0d3d1aee1ab924f30b9910bc517c764917cd:
- `src/bitcoind -regtest` works as expected, now prints logging output
- `src/bitcoind -regtest -noprinttoconsole` successfully silences logging output
- `src/bitcoind -regtest -daemon` successfully silences logging output
utACK 6a3b0d3d1aee1ab924f30b9910bc517c764917cd. Some naming nits in tests.

comments.body: Whoa - good catch to move this inside the `if (fPrintToDebugLog)`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -15,21 +15,25 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.num_nodes = 1
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
 
+    def relative_log_path(self, name):
+        return os.path.join(self.nodes[0].datadir, "regtest", name)
comments.body: nit: IIRC `datadir` is absolute, so the `relative` in the method name is confusing.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,6 +59,17 @@ def run_test(self):
         self.start_node(0, ["-debuglogfile=%s" % (invalidname)])
         assert os.path.isfile(os.path.join(invdir, "foo.log"))
 
+        # check that -nodebuglogfile disables logging
+        self.stop_node(0)
+        os.unlink(default_log_path)
comments.body: Nit: Could use the identical and more clear "remove", since unlink seems to be some unix specific thing, but we also run the tests on windows.
Hmm, won't it print these newlines even if `fPrintToDebugLog` ends up being false?
